Author: Flint#6435
Content: The dollar will dominate for a very long time - do not have illusions! Yes, it will weaken in relation to bitcoin many times, but in a percentage of the dollar turnover in the world and the bitcoin turnover, it is ridiculous to compare! Bitcoin is good if in 50 years it reaches the same turnover as the dollar! Rather, the United States will try to gain control of the most liquid and expensive cryptocurrencies than strengthen its dollar and reduce its public debt

Author: Flint#6435
Content: but for most countries in the world it will be very difficult amid inflation, especially if the world crisis reappears! It will be easier for China and most difficult for Latin America

Author: farl#9964
Content: Yes, the dollar will exist, but not as reserve currency of the world. Too many signals this is getting worse as we speak. And history stated that a reserve currency gets changed every few decades. The dollar is already expired.

Author: Mark81#4505
Content: Isn't chart on apex already be too long for us to get excited?

Author: Mark81#4505
Content: '''Breakout Timeframe: The ideal breakout point occurs 1/2 to 3/4 of the way through the pattern's development or time-span. The time-span of the pattern can be measured from the apex (convergence of upper and lower lines) back to the beginning of the lower trend line (base). A break before the 1/2 way point might be premature and a break too close to the apex may be insignificant. After all, as the apex approaches, a breakout must occur sometime.'''

Content: There has been some external interest for use of Komodo in IoT and similar industries.  However at this time, much still needs built

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: I meant built as in a usecase for the external developer side.   they still are figuring out how to monetize blockchain with IoT effectively, and obviously that is beyond our scope, as we just provide tech.  Though if we could get a demo of a basic use case up I think that might help with the more serious acquisition of third party development.   Something physical, not as abstract as just the code itself.

Author: Flint#6435
Content: MIT students can do this for exampleüòè

Author: Flint#6435
Content: I remember that Komodo had an initiative in the past to encourage and develop students

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: Data security and integrity for PLC‚Äôs utilizing blockchain PoW .   Current issue in industry there is a lack of cyber security for PLC devices , and it is not unheard of for a disgruntled employee or competitor/saboteur to alter the functionality of the PLC and cause massive damage and loss.  Basically recording state / hashes of files on chain secured with PoW and notarizations could greatly mitigate this kind of behavior while being cost effective alarm, forensic and prevention system. Seems to be a combination of DTO observing and reporting to a chain that is being notarized.

Author: Flint#6435
Content: that's who you need to start a partnership with  https://www.te.com/usa-en/industries/sensor-solutions/applications/iot-sensors.html

Content: DEX is the priority first though let‚Äôs not get distracted

Author: Flint#6435
Content: Yes the problem is also that people are afraid to use systems such as smart homes built on the Internet of things because they are afraid of tracking privacy and leakage of personal data, because you have to trust vulnerable software with a single point of failure, and the blockchain solves this problem, and especially the blockchain in partnership with Amazon capable of scaling up to a million operations per second and with a super light client

Author: Flint#6435
Content: @PHBA2061  nSPV is very memory demanding for example

Author: Flint#6435
Content: no need to download the all blockchain and therefore it is applicable in the simplest and most light devices of the IoT
